meanings.definition: To build or make a new nest.
meanings.sent1: The bird was renesting in the tree after the storm destroyed its old nest.
meanings.sent2: The mama bird was renesting in preparation for her new eggs.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to renest in the cozy tree hollow, much to the surprise of the other animals.
meanings.sent4: After the renovation, the family felt like they were renesting in their own home.
meanings.sent5: The robin's determination in renesting inspired the other birds in the forest.

meanings.definition: The act of returning to or settling back into a nest.
meanings.sent1: The renesting of the baby birds brought joy to the whole family.
meanings.sent2: The renesting process was smooth as the birds found their way back to the nest.
meanings.sent3: The renesting of the squirrel in the tree made the children giggle with delight.
meanings.sent4: The renesting of memories in the old house filled her heart with nostalgia.
meanings.sent5: The renesting of the swallows in the eaves marked the beginning of spring.
